metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9777 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description: KVM in the Linux kernel before 4.8.12, when I/O APIC is enabled, does notproperly restrict the VCPU index, which allows guest OS users to gain hostOS privileges or cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds array access andhost OS crash) via a crafted interrupt request, related toarch/x86/kvm/ioapic.c and arch/x86/kvm/ioapic.h.

criterions.comment: linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
